content:
Steal this idea.

Investment decision analysis and simulation platform where future scenario probabilities come from prediction markets.

I actually think this can be built, and be super helpful as prediction markets are the best thing we got next to an oracle.

Steal this idea.

An MVP builder where you input your idea and it cooks up a prototype + a landing page + a paid campaign to drive traffic.

You simply input your idea + $100, and in a few days it tells you how strong the demand is.

Steal this idea:

an AI that shadows the top 0.1% talent in a field as they work and do decision making.

The talent can then license the AI model to different companies as their own official extension.

Steal this idea.

A LinkedIn alternative where companies message you about your work, and you publish them with your answers

Put semantic search on it, so that over them your *real* work gets discovered in terms of what companies actually want instead of what you think they want

Idea: Deep Tank.

It’s like Shark Tank but for deep tech startups.

Will give exposure to few that are actually doing innovative tech in 🇮🇳 India + inspire many others to attempt the same.

If this were to happen, who should be on the judges?

Steal this idea:

A search engine for MCPs.

Add just one MCP, and it helps the LLM find the relevant tools/MCPs across the internet to get the job done.

Anyone is interested in doing this project with me for @lossfunk?

Bootstrap a strong reasoning model via self-improvement.

Idea is simple:
1. Generate many reasoning chains via high-temperature sampling
2. Retain correct ones
3. Use the recent DivPO method for promoting… https://t.co/QpvcpRM8Ck

Idea: a service that crawls my WhatsApp contacts and groups, and builds a searchable dashboard of my network.

I should be able to type a problem I’m facing and it should pop up who from my network can help.

Steal this research idea.

Hypothesis: it'll speed up *both* training and inference.

- Modify next-token prediction task to predicting embeddings of several next paragraphs
- This is a harder task, so loss will drop faster
- At inference, decode embeddings in parallel https://t.co/h5pptuiS4l

startup idea someone should vibe code

"invoice nudger" - a product for freelancers

automatically follows up on unpaid invoices with increasingly assertive (but professional) messages until paid with no awkwardness

let's get independent freelancers paid and happy

thank you.

Steal this idea:

Duolingo for curiosity and discovery.

Take a photo of anything and get a surprising, juicy fact about it, making you learn something new everyday.

(You can easily build this via vision language models!)

startup idea of the day 

spotify but just for babies

can even generate music with AI so you skip paying for music licenses

here's why this could be $20M/year biz 

836k parents search for baby music monthly 

science shows music impacts sleep cycles (and mood) and tired… https://t.co/FA7sXBDbcH

Want a $130k/month AI SaaS startup idea? Me too. I'll share how I look for them (save this guide):

Look for "Export" buttons in enterprise software.

Every time someone exports from Salesforce to analyze deals, or QuickBooks to build reports, or Stripe to reconcile payments -… https://t.co/bgzTeSdyb5

$2m ARR startup idea of the day

rebuild chartable (billboard 100 for podcasters)

just got this email from spotify that chartable is shutting down

from time to time you get a gift like this 

a big company shuts down something a niche of people love

the validation is already… https://t.co/pnqCCUEfom

Idea: a Goodreads like platform where you add the books you read and it generates quizzes for you to help remember important ideas in them (via spaced repetition).

This can be easily bootstrapped via LLMs, especially for popular books.

Idea: a chrome extension that observes how you interact with different websites and over time re-renders them to be more personalised to you by emphasising what you interact with and hiding  what you ignore.

Imagine gmail becoming clutter-free, precisely the way it suits you!

$375k/mo business idea for you 

software that helps mexican/canadian manufacturers avoid tariffs legally. how product can work:

1. optimize shipping routes
2. automate customs
3. ensure compliance
4. find friendly paths

not a logistics entrepreneur but hear me out might be…

startup idea for you 

people think honey sold for $4B to PayPal by saving shoppers money

what they actually built: a massive affiliate hijacking engine that stole revenue from creators/misled people

someone's going to build this right - by sharing value instead of stealing it

Is this a good startup idea by @tferriss?

A speed dating app that is all about getting you on a video call

No IRL meetings until you see if you have chemistry via a FaceTime

You call it The Chemistry™ app.  Made for busy people. 

Charge $50+/month. At 1k users that's… https://t.co/C5UbtUMUPG

Here’s a free billion-dollar startup idea for you...

Reinvent Microsoft Teams or Slack. But, instead of charging $4-$8 per user, charge per message or per new channel.

Enterprise messaging is a multi-billion dollar market, but it's broken. 

CFOs are tearing their hair out…

I'm a startup idea junkie. Maybe you are too?

I interview top founders 2x per week on "The Startup Ideas Podcast"

Here are 8 ideas free startup ideas that could make $10k-$1M/month (with no investors): https://t.co/8057S8wb0Z

Here's an idea:

Instead of paying a college lakhs of rupees for a degree AND then hunting for a job, why not pay an experienced individual for mentorship and then get referred to a job via his/her network.
Idea: a WhatsApp bot that asks you how you’re feeling everyday at random times and suggests names of emotions to help you improve your emotional literacy.

Book idea:

Summaries of what works well for different aspects of life (health, wealth, learning, career, etc) compiled from the highest quality evidence found in meta-reviews published in top journals.

You read the book and you’re up to date on what works and what doesn’t.

Idea: an AI based paper reader which facilitates intuitive understanding of concepts by translating math into code + interactive widgets (with simulations or properties of key concepts).

Imagine deeply understanding new, arcane concepts without leaving the paper you're reading.

This is probably the best business idea of the day.

The playbook:

1. Build audience (650k YouTube subs). Prioritize platforms that you're a natural at
2. Earn trust over a long period of time. Ask only after you've given so much.
3. Make a product no one asks for that everyone… https://t.co/1RNkWQApwk
The whole idea of "majoring "in entrepreneurship at a university is offensive to real entrepreneurs. The only way you "major" in entrepreneurship is building companies with all the ups and downs.

Idea: Tinder for recipes.

You swipe left and right on what you like, and over time the app figures out your taste to start recommending recipes that you’d like but would have never imagined.

Idea: there’s a deluge of AI papers and it’s hard to keep up.

How about a website that generates one line summaries of all papers accepted in top conferences like NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, etc?

Cherry on top: make it into a Tinder-like interface with images picked from the papers.

Steal this idea: take top AI papers and automatically derive interactive visualizations / toy implementations of key ideas in an integrated notebook.

Convert static papers into interactive python notebooks that readers can play along to understand the key innovations.

Someone should build this idea to FLIP the newsletter industry on its head

Because we all know that no one has the time to read 20 newsletters a day

Here's the free startup idea for you...

The best newsletters have 50%+ open rates

So EVEN if you're killing it, you're dead to…

The world is waiting for this idea:

A print-on-demand T-shirt company that embraces AI-art tech fully.

Let people with great ideas but no graphic design skill make killer fashion objects.

Idea: an AI-enabled companion app that records and transcribes conversations and insights from your therapy sessions.

Later, it acts as a daily extension of the therapist, a mood journal and an SOS app to remind you of what you learned about yourself during your therapy sessions

Idea: a book recommendation service that surfaces books across all genres that make you feel like how you felt reading a particular book.

I don’t want to read books on similar topics, but books that make me feel similarly.

Idea: a startup that keeps track of what models are leading on different benchmarks on cost-performance dimensions.

It routes user queries to the right model amongst the thousands that keep on getting released.

App idea: a desktop app that runs in the background and translates voice commands into keyboard shortcuts.

It should know my context (am I in Chrome, Gmail, VS Code, Google Docs, native desktop) and trigger appropriate commands.  E.g. Create bullet, new email, etc.

Steal this idea:

horror movie set in a cinema hall

Idea of the day:

Acquire a struggling cruiseliner like Holland America

License the Soho House brand. Make it "Soho House at Sea"

Rebrand the cruise ships as detox centers on water

No internet, no calls, no phones. Only wellness

Charge 2-3x what Holland America charges. https://t.co/DQQBgABv0A

Steal this idea.

A social media app where content creator’s name + photo is hidden in the timeline by default and is only revealed if the user interacts with the content.

This would enable content to stand on its own merit w/o any bias.

Latest epsiode of my Where it Happens podcast is probably one of my favorite episodes of the year

Lots of laughs and 6 free startup ideas for you to take

Idea #1: Locket for creators 

Idea #2: Apple Vision Pro bars 

Idea #3: A multi-industry fitness product  

Idea #4: Soho… https://t.co/pqgDQIG54y

I just read Pinterest’s 2024 Trend Report and it’s probably got $1B+ worth of startup ideas in it

I can’t believe what I read....some CRAZY trends

Read my analysis on the report (save it):

1. Bodycare will have a major moment in 2024

Startup idea: Eight Sleep of… https://t.co/xVbROw44hp
Many startup ideas fail because they require the user to actually do *more* work, when the whole idea is to make his life easier or simpler.

An idea to improve social media.

Likes should be a currency, everyone gets a limited number of them when they join.

To like a post, you literally have to spend your hard-earned likes.

You can also spend more than one like to express how much you like a particular post.

Idea for a Lock Screen:

give me a new (medium difficulty) math sum to solve each time I want to pick up the phone.

(this extra barrier will ensure over time, unintentional and mindless phone usage reduces.)
Idea: a captcha for emails so that all the automated can be automatically purged, and only genuinely human-crafted emails come to the inbox.
Idea: beautifully designed physical gift cards with Amazon, Netflix, etc coupon codes.

Idea: an auction system for sponsoring planned videos and podcasts from upcoming creators.

As a business, I can bet on what content I feel has potential to viral and piggyback on it.

Idea: smart glasses that analyses whatever you’re doing throughout the day and coaches you the next day on what you could have done better.

Real-time, personalised feedback on literally everything you do.
Idea: an app that gives you choices of words to progressively describe how you’re feeling to arrive at the exact emotional state that you’re in.

Idea: a digital detox phone.

Black and white screen, blackberry style physical keyboard, App Store that excludes social media, camera but no gallery, and a new App Store that lets you buy physical objects as substitutes to apps (comic books, letters, magazines)

Idea: an online course that specially teaches you skills suitable for remote work and how to make money while travelling across the world.

An MBA, but for digital nomads.

Idea: text-to-playlist AI models.

Describe your mood in a sentence, and a playlist is generated that matches your mood precisely.

Come on @Spotify, do it!
Idea: a twitter account that tracks what are all the founders who sold their companies for a bazzilion dollars are doing lately.
Idea for a sleeping app: dry, academic papers read to you by text-to-speech AI models.
Idea: a podcast player where you can ask clarifying questions that an AI answers by scanning multiple sources (the podcast transcript, or rest of the inherent)

Idea: make humans fall for an AI.

use Stable Diffusion for generating stunning profile pictures on Tinder and GPT3 for chat.

When the time for a real date comes, send Boston Dynamics robodog :)

Idea: Why hasn’t anyone made a self-optimising UX framework?

The options that I don’t end up using in a software should automatically keep getting hidden behind some “advanced” settings so that over time I only see clean, minimal version that’s devoid of irrelevant clutter.

Free startup idea of the day: 

Betterhelp for specific niches. They do $800m/year in revenue and are unbundling quickly

TLDR; There is an opportunity to build multiple $1-10M businesses here in 18 months

Let me explain...

Idea: kickstarter for AI models.

Since most investment in AI models is gpu cluster access, people can pool money for training new models (and not rely on closed access companies/groups).

Idea: Canva but with stable diffusion/mid journey built in.

Likely that Canva itself will do it.

Idea: a magazine for generalists that only publishes comprehensive review articles on state-of-the-art in diverse fields written in simple language by experts in those fields.

We can call it Generalist’s Gournal.

Idea for Twitter.

Summarise your timeline automaticaly in a couple of bullet points so you don’t have to doomscroll.

Idea: an art gallery specializing in exhibiting prints of the most beautiful and breathtaking images in science.

Display and sell extremely high-res photos of galaxies, cells, embryos, laminar flow, magnetic lines.. what else?
Idea: a website that anonymously collects regrets that become learning opportunities for people.

Idea: give me analytics on my UPI transactions.

How much I’m spending where and in which categories, give me saving recommendations, help me set limits on spending.

There’s so much that can be done here. Why isn’t anyone doing it?

Free startup idea:

Spotify but ONLY for artists that have less than 10,000 monthly listeners

Make it community-first with intimate spaces for artists to build community

Once the artist hits 10k listeners, they "graduate" to Spotify

What do you think?
Idea: a book that details mistakes and mediocre work from geniuses in various fields to drive home the point that no one is perfect.

A tiny business idea:

I'd definitely be willing to pay for my podcast subscriptions to be transcribed and sent as a physical magazine every month.

Idea: an electrode that directly stimulates the taste receptors on the tongue and olfactory receptors in the nose to create whatever flavor we desire instantly for however long we want, without any of the associated calories.

Idea: a website that curates books written for the general audience by professors and researchers at top universities.

I've consistently found such books to have an insane value-for-invested time.

Idea: a virtual campus where you can walk around (like in a game) with rooms where anyone can teach whatever they like to others.

It’ll be like a real university campus, except online and massively open.

Idea: a Youtube channel that interviews and shows how young people and kids use technology.

They are the early adopters of what feels weird to us, so it'll be cool to learn what's coming next for us.
Idea for a book: document each time anthropic principle was invoked as an explanation for some natural phenomena but which later turned out to be explainable via a deeper principle.

Steal this idea.

An e-commerce story with only super high-quality products from Indian manufacturers / brands.
Idea: a Farmville type of game where when your veggies are ready to be harvested, you actually get them delivered at home. https://t.co/W8wAgfPLjn

Steal this idea.

An online book store that recommends a slightly more challenging book based on the set of books you've read so far.

Good teachers present challenging material in the right order (easy-to-tough) and this can be built into an online recommender system.

Want a crypto startup idea?

Help settle debates with money.

Make a decentralised betting service where people can offer odds for their predictions / claims (like whether coronavirus was lab-made) and others can bet against them.

Let chosen people with reputation be arbiters.

Idea: a helpline where you clarify your muddled thoughts and plans by getting connected to a bright high school student who keeps asking you to explain things until they fully understand what you have in mind.

Steal this idea.

A website that gives one new project challenge daily that doesn’t any digital screens, can be done within 60-90 minutes and only requires easily available materials.

Bonus points if you enable project takers to submit photos / videos of their creations.

Here’s an idea I’ve been toying with.

A website where people submit their notes from books and articles in form of Anki cards that anyone can subscribe to and via spaced repetition, retain ideas from such books and articles.

Think of it as Substack but for notes.

Here’s an idea: all industries should have a professional competition like the car industry has F1 racing.

We will get not just more sports, but faster innovation that will push products further.

One idea I’m toying with us create a betting platform for scientific predictions.

For example, if @anderssandberg has high confidence that we may be the only intelligent life in the universe, you should be able to bet for or against that conjecture.

Here’s an idea for a new cryptocurrency:

- Create a bitcoin-like protocol

- Teach people programming, cryptography and blockchain

- Have them implement a full-node of the protocol from scratch

- Charge for the course in the very same coins that students implement a node for

Idea for a game: a space-civilization strategy game that takes special and general relativity seriously, with all their interesting "paradoxes" and counterintuitive notions of space and time come alive in various game dynamics.

Idea for an AI project:

Automatic game generation by having an agent that gets bored if not challenged and a designer that uses a physics engine to ensure the agent doesn’t get bored.
Idea to make cities more sustainable: governments should come up with a sustainability rating for households and give tax breaks for getting a high rating.

Idea: hide investing behind a really fun game, charge money per play and depending on user actions in the game, invest the money in some indexes / stocks behind the scenes.

If the user gets addicted to the game, they’ll end up building long term wealth.
Idea: Netflix but with only high quality lectures on various topics for the wider public.

Here’s an idea:

To get automatic discounts on products, buy shares or companies that you often purchase things from.

That way, whenever you pay them, you’re only paying for the cost price (and not for the margins).
Billion dollar idea: highflix.
It’s so easy to read hundreds of pages without internalizing even a single idea.

Here’s an idea: govt should start making and publicising a top 100 list of organisations and entrepreneurs that have created most amount of public good (measured on money scale).

Replace accumulated wealth with accumulated status points, and create public goods as a side effect.
Idea: a protocol or a service that allows trustworthy, reciprocal exchange of information on business metrics between two competitors to benchmark where they truly are next to each other.

Startup idea: a helpline for people in their 20s to give them basic financial  literacy.

Just avoiding basic mistakes in 20s (like keeping everything in savings or buying a house or settling at a low salary) can make people substantially richer in life.

Idea: can someone start a daily newsletter describing briefly all the papers/pre-prints that are coming out regarding covid-19? 

You can host it on substack.

You can use https://t.co/2QyqWg3UZU to source papers (built by @karpathy)

Idea: an app where the very best Twitter threads are curated under various categories.

It’s amazing to think that this doesn’t exist. (At least I couldn’t find)

Idea: Sponsor-A-Scientist website where you scientists can raise crowdfunding for their research (to employ additional students, postdocs or buy equipment).

In return, the patrons get to talk to scientist fortnightly and understand latest research in their areas.

Here’s an idea for faster human trials for coronavirus

- Recruit people on death roll to participate in the study
- Give placebo and vaccines to randomised groups
- Give people who fall ill really good medical care
- Pardon death sentence for everyone who participates

Steal this idea: a website or an app where people can list things they want to give away for free, and others can search what things they can get from their neighbours for free (before they make a purchase).

Steal this idea: a course that trains and develops all our senses by exposing students to deep fragrances, visuals, sounds, textures, etc.

In a world of mono culture, developing a richer appreciation for the world around us would be amazing.
Here’s an idea: co-working and co-living spaces in forests for those who have remote jobs / freelancers.

Here's an idea: give Earth a legal status just like corporations.

Then Earth should be able to sue oil companies for the unauthorised use of its resources and demand compensation. Earth can deploy this 'revenue' to ensure that it doesn't die as an entity.
Idea: fractional ownership in local restaurants that you really like
Project idea: analyse tweets of a person to compose an exact sequence of words that will trigger an existential crisis in that person but will everyone else unimpacted.

Steal this idea: a website where short anecdotes and (real life) stories all imaginable topics are curated.

Useful for writers and presenters to discover and include stories that make dry facts and thoughts interesting to the audience.

Here’s an idea: rephrase ‘Global Warming’ as ‘Earth Taking Revenge’.

Say the revenge is coming harder on us. Look at the storms, heatwaves and immigration. Earth-chan is angry.

Personify the hurt and perhaps we’ll act.

Project idea: scan through tweets of a user to detect inconsistent tweets and tweet what is found back to the user to choose which one among all views s/he really believes in.

It’ll be fun to see this for politicians and twitter gurus.

Steal this idea: Uber for volunteerism.

You open the app and see hyper-local tasks from charities around you. In your free time you can go around the city doing those tasks.

Charge a cut on donations, but connecting NGO proposed tasks with volunteers is free.
Machine Learning project idea: train a model to predict pollution level just based on a photo of the sky. Put that model onto an app, and let anyone predict pollution levels just by taking a photo.

Here’s a free idea to @Twitter for generating extra revenue.

Start charging a yearly fee to whoever wants a verified status. The ✔️ next to account name is the Gucci-bag equivalent. 

Don’t give it for free, monetise it. Cc: @jack

Heres an idea: let authors of scientific papers bet their own money on a prediction of how many citations they’ll get in (say) a year. 

This will bubble up authors who are very confident of importance of their findings.

Wild idea: a social network for bots. 

Each bot will get two endpoints: 1) for posting generative text (or images) whenever that end-point is called. 2) for analyzing whenever another bot (that this bot follows) posts something and giving upvote or downvote.
Here’s an idea: a dead man’s switch for a company where their escrowed code will become public if they cease operations.

Here’s an idea to anonymously gather people for a common cause.

Lock a million dollars in a smart contract and announce that everyone who comes to a particular place wearing a T-shirt with their public key as QR codes gets $100 (anonymously pay CCTV company to install cameras)

Here’s an idea: track donations on blockchain (so total contributions visibly accumulate) and give health and life insurance; allow some % of total donated so far to be withdrawn for emergencies (taken from other donators)

Does this incentivise you to increase your donations?

Here’s an idea: run a prediction market for new scientific papers to predict their number of citations in next 5 years.

Discover ground breaking research even from obscure journals.

Also helps scientists move away from paid journals that charge for signalling.
Idea: make a town where you can physically roam and understand mathematics. From streets to monuments to statues to bars, all tourist attractions serve to explain intuitively a complicated topic.
Side project idea: map music chords and sounds to keystrokes so that with each email you type, a new song comes.

Idea for YouTube channel: punjabi uncle vs deep learning. 

S01e01 - a researcher showing how his algorithm can reliably detect a banana, and Malhotra uncle is like: ‘isme kya, yeh to saadha 2 saal da titu vi das denda hai’
Book idea: a math book that doesn’t explain but gently nudges you to *invent* math from first principles.
Idea for a new institute: a sabbatical house where scientists, artists and creators come, do *whatever* interests them and go, but everyone lives in the same campus.
My new idea of vacation is reading a beautiful interdisciplinary research paper with a fresh and bold perspective.

Here’s an idea: deep networks are so successful at predicting real world phenomena because our natural world is also deep. 

atoms -> molecules -> organic chains -> cells -> organs -> organisms -> behaviour.

#Idea: send satellites packed with most important human knowledge backups to rotate around earth at various distances.

These satellites listen to signals from earth and when such signals stop, they return to earth with all the backups.

Project #idea: connect with Goodreads/Kindle account and show top quotes/snippets from the book on NEW Browser tabs to reiterate and remember key ideas via spaced repetition.

cc @ncasenmare (because you recently made this spaced repetition explorable: https://t.co/hEjE6s3lZb)
#Idea: a science journal that ONLY publishes papers from independent, non-affiliated researchers (who do science on side, keeping their main jobs).

I have an idea for a project: a raspberry pi powered robot that follows you around and asks annoying questions on whether you are keeping up with your life goals.

Imagine a robot 🧸 asking you everyday if you meditated or went to gym.
Idea #2: A freelancing site where people do work for you in exchange for likes and follows on their social profiles.

Idea #1: A grocery store, like Amazon Go, in low income neighbourhoods where you literally don’t have to pay anything. Pick anything you want and walk away.

Funded by philanthropists.

Idea: books on various topics written by expert authors who disagree with each other. Chapters written in the format of explanation-criticism. 

Will open readers' minds much more than the traditional confirmation-bias ridden single-author books.
Steal this idea: fork of Postgres where missing values are automatically and continuously filled by ML without extra effort from user
Idea for a new school: reinvent curriculum from ground up, assure students of basic income if they don't get a job
Steal this idea -> a social network where 80% ad money goes to charities of users' choice.
Idea for a YouTube show: invite intelligent folks to volunteer and have them solve difficult problems through first principles.
How’s this for an idea: a concierge service for getting rid of old stuff from your house?
Startup idea: AI powered virtual, skinnable DJs for clubs and events.
Side project idea: a script that scans your code repo and sends you email once a month to thank maintainers of open source projects you use
Startup idea: a YouTube trending section replacement that doesn’t suck.
Today's idea: train a neural network on known cases of insider trading, and then use it on live market to make money.
Random startup idea: make a product for parents to let their newborn learn an additional language by constantly playing it in the background
Today’s free idea: Register https://t.co/f05xOylrps (it’s available) and pay 10 cents to anyone submitting 12 ideas. Show all ideas publicly
Startup idea -> make AirBnB for sabbaticals
There should be a Wordpress plugin where you can pay people to edit blog post and suggest how to improve the writing. #steal #this #idea pl
Website idea -> Day in life of X where X could be anything: software sales exec, president, dog catcher, nuclear scientist, prostitute, etc.
Startup idea: make a Wikipedia for dummies.

@hustlin_heev perplexity ai "top 10 best mattresses reddit"

glhf

every b2b company is the same growth strategy

build a software similar but better to what people are using right now

then

find all your customers contact information

cold email, call, text all of them

customer match list across all channels

ads

make content they like

glhf

twixxer released dedicated video tab for mobile yesterday

probably not a huge arbitrage for you to capitalize on with business and growth shorts shilling whatever product you're trying to get in front of money twixxer

glhf https://t.co/vDVUmK8aVq

if i was kit .com

i'd write 10,000+ articles for every "how to mailchimp" keyword and "mailchimp vs x competitor" keyword programmatically in 48 hours and publish in 30 days to double organic traffic 

have CTA to signup inline every screen fold and a popup to sign up 

glhf https://t.co/GhDC3RbE6l

business idea for you 

recruiting ai 

it could do

candidate sourcing

screening and assessment

candidate engagement

gtm is cold email to recruiting agencies

glhf https://t.co/JyBFxBLVm0

if i was julius ai 

id write 50,000+ articles for every "how to x tableau" and "how to x power BI"  tutorial articles programmatically in 48 hours and publish and in 30 days double organic traffic 

have CTA to signup inline every screen fold and a popup to sign up 

glhf https://t.co/ah0M3yrCeR

Steal this idea.

Reinvent textbooks.

An e-ink based interactive book with AI integrated, where you learn via interactive exercises that you literally hand write an answer to and get immediate feedback from AI.

Watching videos on a digital screen seems passive and eye-hurting.

Steal this idea.

A meet-up where all everyone does is read things that have been accumulating in their to read infinitely long list, and later discuss the highlights of what they read.

Brownie points if each meet-up is themed so you read psychology, history, AI, etc only.

Steal this idea.

An AI/LLM interface specifically designed around understanding large, complex topics, projects or papers.

e.g. you upload a paper or github repo link, and it patiently breaks it down component after component, zooming in and out, until you fully understand it.

Steal this idea.

A mouth-vocalization to text via camera.

Many people (including me) don't use voice input because it feels awkward, especially in public settings.

What if you could track movement of mouth, jaw, lips etc to decode purely from camera what a person is speaking.

Steal this idea.

A service that ingests your chats with LLMs (chatgpt, Claude, etc) and does continuous background deep research to generate a social media like feed with useful articles and videos on precise topics youre interested in.

Steal this idea.

An AI-powered coding agent on WhatsApp.

Wrap Claude Code or Gemini CLI on WhatsApp api, and enable millions to easily build their first app/website.

Make money selling domains and hosting for apps they make.

Steal this idea.

LLM-infused-debugger.

You describe the bug and the agent steps through the code, adds breakpoints, checks variables, adds print statements and figure out the bug and then fixes it.

Perfect agent use case.

Steal this idea.

A screen timer app that presents Anki cards for learning whenever you open an app/website you want to limit your access to.

So when you open Instagram, instead of a plain blocker, youre given a Duolingo sort of UX to learn a set of cards of your choice.

Steal this idea.

A daily game for vibe coding fun ideas.

Every day, the game releases a slightly under specified prompt (like an angry todo list) and people compete to build their versions of it.

Community votes for their favourites!

Steal this idea.

Cursor for making Duolingo-like learning apps.

Work with educators and experts to convert their area of expertise into fully interacting, immersive learning experiences.

(Dont limit to MCQs, generate code that powers mini-apps for explainers and simulations)

Steal this idea.

A browser plugin that allows you to modify behavior of any website you regularly visit based on natural language.
